review_items.example_en: The humid heat enervated the runners.
review_items.label: review

review_items.en_definition: to make uneasy or embarrass; to thwart
review_items.example_en: The unexpected question seemed to discomfit him.
review_items.example_zh: 那個突如其來的問題讓他有些窘迫。
review_items.label: review

review_items.en_definition: slow to act; intended to cause delay
review_items.example_en: The board took a dilatory approach to the safety fix.
review_items.example_zh: 董事會對安全修正一再拖延。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: A perfidious partner leaked the strategy.
review_items.example_zh: 一位不忠的夥伴洩了策略。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: His polemical column sparked fierce debate.
review_items.example_zh: 他好辯的專欄引發激烈討論。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: The mendacious report misled the public.
review_items.example_zh: 那份不實的報告誤導了大眾。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: A captious reviewer nitpicked every paragraph.
review_items.example_zh: 挑剔的審稿人對每段都吹毛求疵。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: Critics excoriated the film's lazy script.
review_items.example_zh: 影評人痛斥這部片懶散的劇本。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: His emails grew querulous under pressure.
review_items.example_zh: 壓力之下他的電郵越來越愛抱怨。
review_items.label: review

review_items.en_definition: to use ambiguous language to mislead
review_items.example_en: He tends to equivocate when the stakes are high.
review_items.example_zh: 在關鍵時刻他總是含糊其詞。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: They faced the ineluctable deadline together.
review_items.example_zh: 他們一起面對不可避免的死線。
review_items.label: review

review_items.en_definition: to care for and protect overindulgently
review_items.example_en: Grandparents often cosset the youngest child.
review_items.example_zh: 祖父母常常溺愛家中的么兒。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: The article was pure calumny and had to be retracted.
review_items.example_zh: 那篇文章純屬誹謗，最後被撤回。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_zh: 諂媚的恭維讓她不自在。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: The memo tried to obfuscate the real costs.
review_items.example_zh: 這份備忘錄試圖混淆真實成本。
review_items.label: review

review_items.example_en: She is assiduous in her archival research.
review_items.example_zh: 她在檔案研究上非常勤勉。
review_items.label: review

review_items.en_definition: to clear from alleged fault or guilt
review_items.example_en: New evidence exculpated the wrongly accused.
review_items.example_zh: 新證據讓被冤枉的人得以脫罪。
review_items.label: review
